title: Submission of the Report to Parliament on the Deviation of Headline Inflation from the Inflation Target set out in the Monetary Policy Framework Agreement
decision_details: - In terms of the Monetary Policy Framework Agreement under section 26(1) of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka Act, No.16 of 2023, the responsibility of maintaining the quarterly headline inflation as measured by the Colombo Consumer Price Index at 5% is vested with the Central Bank of Sri Lanka. As per section (26)(5) of the said Agreement, if the Central Bank of Sri Lanka fails to meet the said inflation targets within a specified margin for two consecutive quarters, the Monetary Policy Board of the Central Bank should submit a Report thereon to Parliament, through the Minister in‑charge of the subject of Finance. The average quarterly headline inflation based on the Colombo Consumer Price Index in the second and third quarters of the year 2024 has been reported as 1.4% and 0.8% respectively, which indicates a drop from the lower margin of the said inflation target. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Hon. President in his capacity as the Minister of Finance, Planning and Economic Development to table the Report including the aforesaid matters on the Deviation of Headline Inflation, submitted to him under the provisions of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka Act, to Parliament, was approved by the Cabinet.
